page.title: 19Housing around Bentley
page.content: {Housing}in the area is very dispersed. Even the villages of Upper and Lower Bentley and Woodgate Have only a few Houses and none have a village centre. As the area is agricultural most of the houses are farm houses or{farm {workers cottages.}Many of them are old, some are{timber framed}though most are{brick built.}Some cottages have been modernised and are now homes to business men who travel to the nearby towns to work. Some new bungalows have been built but they are individual ones not part of a development. There are some farm workers homes that were built after the Second World War. One person lives in a small caravan which is permanently sited in Woodgate.
